channel.title: IP Development Knowledge Transfer
channel.description: Recent content on IP Development Knowledge Transfer

item.title: post0 2
item.description:
Tools to Get Started

In order to get started, below are the main hub of the name and description of each application you will use throughout the IP Development rotation. Please create a login and/or download to your desktop.

Slack

Slack is a cloud based team collaboration tool. Click here to download.

Kitematic

Click here to download Kitematic.

Postman

Postman is a Google Chrome app for interacting with HTTP APIs. It presents you with a friendly GUI for constructing requests and reading responses.

Click here to download.

Github

Github is a web-based Git repository hosting service

Click here to download.

Visual Studio Code

Visual Studio Code is a source code editor developed by Microsoft for Windows, Linux, and Mac OS.

Click here to download.

The Phoenix Project

The Phoenix project is a novel about IT, DevOps, and helping your business win. Kevin will provide you an amazon kindle gift to download and read it.

item.title: post 01
item.description:
Introduction: What to Expect

When first reading the name IP Development, you may (like me) at first be confused by the name and wonder what the rotation might entail. Soon after realizing that the rotation is mostly concerned with programming, software tools, and different development methodologies, the thought occurs- is this all about programming (EEK!)? You need not worry. This rotation is catered to its participants and the overall goal of the rotation is not to try to be a coding boot camp. Instead, you will learn about the tools, programming languages, and methodologies used by Forsythe to deliver cutting edge IT solutions.

Have you heard about virtualization or Hybrid Cloud? Any ideas on what a container is? Have you installed a distribution of Linux? If you answered yes to any of these questions-GREAT! If not- GREAT! Expect to leave this rotation with having a firm and solid understanding of how Forsythe delivers cutting edge IT Solutions across the spectrum of the broad IT spectrum (See Slide).

After analyzing this slide you should have come to the realization that maybe your knowledge of the IT spectrum may be lacking. If you are like me, you will enter into this rotation with more questions than answers, and that is in fact encouraged (ASK QUESTIONS!) The end goal of this rotation is that you may be able to speak intelligently to this slide and explain how it applies to Forsytheâ€™s practices.

Ultimately, the goal of the rotation is to walk away with a true understanding of how IT is evolving and how development plays a major role (DevOps).
